decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - TThe proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (2014_17_P01, 2014_17_P02, 2014_17_P03, 2014_17_P04, 2014_17_P05, 2014_17_P06, 2014_17_P07, 2014_17_P08, 2014_17_P09, 2014_17_P010, 2014_17_P011, Design and Access Statement dated February 2016. Received on 24 February 2016) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - No excavation or construction work shall be undertaken prior to the submission and approval in writing by the Local Planning Authority, of a Construction Method Statement, which is certified by a qualified professional giving details of excavation, temporary works and construction techniques, including details of potential impacts on neighbouring land based on assessment of the geology and hydrology of the area.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 0800 to 1800 on Mondays to Friday and 0900 to 1300 on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 6 - The basement shall at no time be used or occupied as a separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall not be used as sleeping accommodation.

Condition : 7 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public.

Condition : 8 - No development shall take place until a Demolition and Construction Management Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to demonstrate that the works can be carried out outside peak times of St Mary's Primary School.  A Construction Management Plan should include details of any highway impact and control, details of any site containment during demolition and construction work, vehicular parking arrangements, controls over mud and other loose materials being discharged onto the public highway and control over any potential dust nuisance being caused to adjacent properties.
description: Creation of a basement including front and rear lightwells to the house
